intro: Dendranthema coreanum, commonly known as the Korean chamomile, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and has hairy, linear leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens. Its aromatic properties make it useful in traditional medicine and as a natural remedy.
